metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2805 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox ESR 38.xbefore 38.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code viaunknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
